attributes.action: Reform post-mortem procedures, our dearly beloved do not deserve to be kept from their Qabr (Grave)
attributes.additional_details: We Strive to bury the deceased as soon as possible after death, avoiding the need for embalming or otherwise disturbing the body of the deceased. The inquest procedure involves performing autopsy on the deceased to determine the cause of death or to aid any investigation. This can take days after the death and in many cases months. So we ask for our religious importances to be taken into consideration and changes to be made to the procedures and time of lenght that is being used after a death of a Muslim. (And any other religion which shares the same belief)
